page.title: 14Petworth Ethiopia Appeal
page.content: Petworth Ethiopia is a famine relief fund organised by Petworth Christian Fellowship. Different organisations in the town have come together to try and save the Ethiopians. It started in November 1984 when a group of people met to pray about what they should do. The peolpe who helped to save for Ethiopia raised Â£4800 to buy grain. They raised it by doing the following - sponsored slim, silence, walk and skip. Also they organised coffee mornings, piano tuning, making dolls clothes and selling song cassettes which they had made. On Tuesday 16th April 1985 the grain left Petworth. The 46 tonnes were contained in over 900 sacks.
